decks.notes: This Dimir Control deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan by using a combination of counterspells, removal, and card advantage to stay ahead in resources. The deck utilizes powerful Vintage staples like Force of Will, Ancestral Recall, Time Walk, and Demonic Tutor to control the game and find key combo pieces like Time Vault and Manifold Key. By leveraging the powerful card advantage provided by LÃ³rien Revealed and other draw spells, this deck aims to outvalue opponents and secure victory through control of the game state.

This deck aims to quickly fill the graveyard with creatures such as Stinkweed Imp, Golgari Grave-Troll, and Golgari Thug, then utilize cards like Dread Return and Bridge from Below to bring powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis into play. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a large number of creatures and generate a big advantage in the mid to late game. Cards like Noxious Revival and Cabal Therapy help to manipulate the graveyard and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Overall, the deck is focused on utilizing powerful graveyard synergies to win the game.

The deck focuses on utilizing artifacts and spells to control the game by disrupting opponents' strategies, generating card advantage, and ultimately winning through combo plays involving Time Vault. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for additional recursion of low-cost permanents. With a strong mana base and a variety of versatile cards like Moxen, counterspells, and tutors, the deck aims to outmaneuver opponents and maintain control of the game until it can assemble its win condition.

The deck focuses on assembling powerful artifacts quickly and efficiently using cards such as Coveted Jewel, Grim Monolith, and Urza's Saga. By utilizing Paradoxical Outcome, the player can bounce their artifacts back to hand to draw a significant amount of cards and generate mana advantage. With cards like Karn, the Great Creator and Tinker, the deck can tutor for game-winning pieces like Time Vault. The deck aims to control the game with counterspells like Force of Will while generating a powerful board state with its artifacts.

The deck focuses on controlling the board while using Oath of Druids to cheat powerful creatures into play. It includes various counterspells and removal spells to disrupt the opponent's game plan, as well as powerful tutors to find key cards quickly. Atraxa, Grand Unifier is a key creature that can quickly take over the game if left unchecked. The deck also includes Show and Tell to help put creatures into play without having to rely solely on Oath of Druids. Overall, the deck aims to control the game until it can cheat out powerful threats to secure the win.

The deck revolves around using Paradoxical Outcome to bounce and replay artifacts for card advantage and mana generation. It aims to quickly assemble the Time Vault + Key combo to take extra turns and win the game. It also includes powerful artifacts like The One Ring and Coveted Jewel for additional benefits. The deck includes cards like Force of Will and Sink into Stupor for disruption, as well as mana acceleration from Grim Monolith and Mishra's Workshop. The strategy combines powerful artifacts with control elements to create a deadly combo deck in Vintage 1 vs 1 format.

This deck focuses on using the Paradoxical Outcome combo to generate card advantage and win the game quickly. The key strategy involves leveraging powerful artifacts like Moxen, Time Vault, and Sol Ring to generate mana and then using cards like Ancestral Recall and Brainstorm to draw into more combo pieces. Lurrus of the Dream-Den is utilized as a companion to provide additional recursion and value. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Force of Will and Spell Pierce to protect the combo. Overall, the deck aims to assemble its combo pieces quickly and overwhelm the opponent.

The deck focuses on generating mana quickly using artifacts like Grim Monolith and Mishra's Workshop, to cast spells like Paradoxical Outcome and Tinker to search for combo pieces such as Time Vault and The One Ring. The deck also includes control elements like Force of Will and Sink into Stupor to protect the combo. Additional support comes from powerful artifacts like Coveted Jewel and Mystic Forge. The goal is to assemble the combo pieces and generate infinite turns or mana to overwhelm the opponent in a quick and efficient manner.

This deck focuses on fast, aggressive plays with a mix of powerful artifacts and disruptive spells to control the game. It aims to quickly establish a strong board presence while limiting the opponent's options with cards like Force of Will and Archon of Emeria. The inclusion of powerful cards like Tinker, Time Walk, and Bolas's Citadel allows for explosive turns and potential game-ending plays. By utilizing a combination of synergistic creatures and artifacts, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory before they can stabilize.

This deck focuses on generating a large amount of mana quickly and efficiently through powerful mana rocks and rituals, allowing the player to cast multiple spells in a single turn. The goal is to assemble a combination of cards that will create a storm count, such as casting multiple spells in a turn, and then finish the game with a lethal Tendrils of Agony. The deck contains various tutors and card draw to find key combo pieces, as well as disruption in the form of counterspells to protect the combo.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by using a combination of counterspells, removal, and card advantage. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while efficiently drawing into answers and threats. The inclusion of powerful and disruptive cards like Force of Will, Demonic Tutor, and Lavinia, Azorius Renegade helps ensure the deck can handle a variety of threats and strategies. By effectively managing resources and using key combo pieces like Time Vault and Manifold Key, the deck aims to outlast and outmaneuver opponents in a slow and methodical manner.

This deck focuses on utilizing powerful control elements such as counterspells, removal, and card draw to manipulate the game in your favor. It utilizes a variety of artifacts and efficient spells to disrupt your opponent's game plan while maintaining card advantage and tempo. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion provides additional value and recursion. The deck aims to outlast the opponent by shutting down their threats and establishing a dominant board presence through strategic plays and resource management.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through various means such as countering spells, searching for specific cards, and disrupting the opponent's strategy. It utilizes powerful artifacts like Time Vault and Mana Crypt, as well as versatile cards like Balance and Lavinia, Azorius Renegade to keep the opponent in check. The inclusion of companions like Lurrus of the Dream-Den adds another layer of strategy and consistency to the deck. Overall, the key concept of this Esper Control deck is to outmaneuver and outlast the opponent through resource management and disruption.

This deck focuses on disrupting and slowing down the opponent's game plan with hatebear creatures like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben, Chancellor of the Annex, and Anointed Peacekeeper, while also maintaining a strong aggro presence with creatures like Archon of Emeria and Seasoned Dungeoneer. The deck utilizes powerful mana acceleration from various Moxen and Lotus cards to quickly get ahead on board and apply pressure. With disruptive elements and a fast clock, this deck aims to control the game while keeping opponents on the back foot.

This Vintage 1 vs 1 Control deck focuses on using Oath of Druids to quickly put powerful creatures into play. The deck is built around Atraxa, Grand Unifier and includes a variety of powerful artifacts and enchantments like Null Rod and Bolas's Citadel to control the game. With efficient card draw and counter spells like Force of Will, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while setting up its own strong board presence. The combination of Oath of Druids and Show and Tell allows for explosive plays and quick victories.

This deck aims to generate a lot of mana and draw through the deck quickly to assemble key pieces for an explosive win. It employs cards like Paradoxical Outcome and Mystic Forge to generate card advantage and potentially infinite mana using artifacts such as Grim Monolith and Mana Vault. The deck also features interaction and disruption with cards like Force of Will and Trinisphere, while utilizing cards like Tinker and Karn, the Great Creator for powerful plays. The overall strategy revolves around maximizing mana generation and card draw to win in a single turn.
